revised_title: Observations on the Specific Gravity, Temperature, and Composition of Arctic Sea-Water and Ice
tldr: The author investigates the specific gravity, temperature, and composition of Arctic sea-water and ice during an expedition. They find that the water has a low specific gravity and temperature, and the ice has a disturbed proportion of chlorides and sulfates. The author also examines the structure of the ice, noting its horizontal stratification and the varying salinity levels within it.
